page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO BOURNE END
page.content: The area is in the Thames Valley and includes the villages of Bourne End and Wooburn.Bourne End is the more residential of the two,with modern housing estates stretching into Flackwell Heath, across rolling hills and once fruit-filled cherry orchards. There are also Victorian and Edwardian houses and a few thatched cottages. Enid Blyton and Edgar Wallace,who is buried in the local cemetery,both lived in the area. Factories back onto fields and farms. The Abbotsbrook and Industrial estates are the two extremes in Bourne End,the latter,a few years old,whereas the former has outlived generations.The main road and railway station provide easy access to London and other main cities.The Thames is popular with residents and attracts tourists,who fish,sail and walk along the banks.
